comment_text: The second impact

I saw red snow falling to the ground in N-E Wisconsin, in the latter part of the 50's.  I could not figure out what was going on.  I tried to get some on a glass microscope slide, but the slide was too warm. It had been in the house, and the snow flakes would melt. It wasn't until years later, that I heard a man on Art Bell discussing red snow. He said it was algae in the atmosphere that was a part of the snow.  Finally, found out WHAT it was.
